holidays.name: Spouse's Day
holidays.description: A day to appreciate, love, and thank your spouse for putting up with you, and to celebrate your unique partnership.
holidays.origin: Started to encourage married couples to take a moment to acknowledge their significant other and the commitment they share.
holidays.funFact: Spouse's Day is unofficial, but many couples use it as an excuse to spoil each other with silly gifts and surprise dates.

holidays.name: Opposite Day
holidays.description: A quirky day when everything you say or do is taken in reverse meaning: yes means no, up means down, and left means right!
holidays.origin: A playful invention by children that has grown into a weird cultural phenomenon across schools and social circles.
holidays.funFact: Philosophers have jokingly pondered if Opposite Day creates paradoxes‚Äîlike if you say 'Opposite Day is today' on Opposite Day, is it really?!

holidays.name: Potato Day
holidays.description: A day to honor and celebrate the humble potato, one of the world‚Äôs most versatile and beloved foods.
holidays.origin: Observed by many regions that rely heavily on potatoes as a staple crop, it‚Äôs become a fun culinary holiday worldwide.
holidays.funFact: The world's largest potato weighed over 11 pounds‚Äîabout as much as a small bowling ball!

holidays.name: Australia Day
holidays.description: National day of Australia celebrating the arrival of the First Fleet at Sydney Cove in 1788. Marked by festivities, citizenship ceremonies, and sometimes debate.
holidays.origin: Commemorates the establishment of the first British colony in Australia and is both a celebration and a day of reflection on its history.
holidays.funFact: Australia Day is celebrated with 'barbie' (barbecue) gatherings where locals grill everything from sausages to kangaroo meat!
